nodes.name: SL5 Project
nodes.description: Security Level 5 Initiative - Advanced AI infrastructure security project

sources.text: RAND Report: Securing AI Model Weights

nodes.name: OpenAI
nodes.description: Major AI research lab and model developer

nodes.name: DPR Construction
nodes.description: Largest data center contractor in the nation with 31% of overall company revenue attributed to mission critical work in 2024. Specializes in AI-driven mission-critical infrastructure with expertise in liquid cooling systems and hyperscale facilities.
research: Crusoe Energy AI Data Center on Lancium Clean Campus - Abilene, Texas with 100,000 GPUs capacity
Meta Louisiana Data Center - Richland Parish, 4 million sq ft, $10 billion investment, largest Meta facility to date
Meta Mesa Data Center - Arizona, 2.5+ million sq ft
Oracle/OpenAI Stargate project facilities in Abilene, Texas - $1.1 billion total cost, 500,000 sq ft buildings

nodes.name: Blue Owl Capital (Financial Partner/Developer)
nodes.description: Leading asset management firm with $192 billion in assets under management, focused on flexible financing solutions for AI and hyperscale data center developers. Makes strategic partnerships with construction companies.
research: $3.4 billion joint venture with Crusoe for AI data center campus in Texas with 100,000 GPUs
$5 billion joint venture with Chirisa Technology Parks and PowerHouse Data Centers for CoreWeave facilities
$15 billion joint venture for 1.2 GW Abilene, Texas facility

nodes.name: Crusoe Energy Systems
nodes.description: Denver-based AI infrastructure company specializing in sustainable data centers with on-site renewable energy generation. Purpose-built for AI workloads with direct-to-chip liquid cooling capabilities.
research: Abilene, Texas AI campus - 1.2 GW capacity, 100,000 GPUs, leased to Oracle for OpenAI workloads
Lancium Clean Campus - multi-building AI data center with renewable energy

nodes.name: CoreWeave (Infrastructure Provider)
nodes.description: AI hyperscaler and specialized GPU cloud provider with over $12 billion in funding. Operates 28+ data center facilities globally, specializing in GPU-as-a-Service for AI workloads.
research: Lancaster County, Pennsylvania - $6+ billion investment, 300 MW capacity
Ellendale, North Dakota - 250 MW campus via Applied Digital
Multiple global facilities across 28 locations by end of 2024

nodes.name: Oracle (Infrastructure Partner)
nodes.description: Major cloud infrastructure provider building datacenter capacity for OpenAI through the Stargate project. Working with multiple construction partners for gigawatt-scale facilities.
research: Stargate Phase 1 - Abilene, Texas, 1.2 GW capacity with 10+ buildings of 500,000 sq ft each
Multiple planned Stargate locations across 16 states

nodes.name: Dane Stuckey
nodes.description: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) - Former CISO of Palantir Technologies, joined OpenAI in October 2024. Has over a decade of experience in digital forensics, incident response, and security program development. Served at Palantir for more than ten years, including six-plus years as CISO. Started at Palantir in 2014 on the information security team as a detection engineering and incident response lead.
research: Leading OpenAI's security efforts to protect hundreds of millions of users
Working on compliance, trust, and security standards
Supporting development of safe AGI

nodes.name: Matt Knight
nodes.description: Head of Security - Head of Security at OpenAI since 2020, building IT, privacy and security programs. Has background in electrical engineering and previously co-founded Agitator, a cybersecurity and radio frequency research startup. Leads security engineering and building systems for developing and deploying advanced AI. Background in hardware, software, and wireless security.
research: Using LLMs for OpenAI's internal security program
Cybersecurity grant program
Security research collaboration with broader security community
OpenAI Safety and Security Committee member
AI-powered security automation for incident reporting and detection

nodes.name: Paul M. Nakasone
nodes.description: Board Member and Safety and Security Committee Member - Retired U.S. Army General and former NSA Director. Served as Commander of U.S. Cyber Command and Director of NSA/CSS since May 2018 until retirement in February 2024. Leading expert in cybersecurity, technology advancement, and global cyber defense. Appointed to OpenAI board in June 2024.
research: Leading OpenAI's Safety and Security Committee
Established NSA's unclassified Cybersecurity Collaboration Center
Formation of NSA's Artificial Intelligence Security Center
Contributing to AI cybersecurity threat detection and response

nodes.name: Aleksander Madry
nodes.description: Head of Preparedness - Professor at MIT in the department of electrical engineering and computer science. Earned PhD in computer science from MIT. Leading figure in AI research, particularly focusing on machine learning, optimization, and algorithmic robustness. Member of OpenAI's Safety and Security Committee.
research: Safety and Security Committee member
AI risk evaluation and preparedness frameworks
Research in algorithmic robustness and machine learning

nodes.name: Lilian Weng
nodes.description: Former Head of Safety Systems (departed November 2024) - Former VP of Research and Safety who departed OpenAI in November 2024 after 7 years. Previously head of OpenAI's safety systems team with over 80 scientists, researchers, and policy experts. Joined OpenAI in 2018 working on robotics team, later transitioned to applied AI research and then safety systems.
research: Built OpenAI's Safety Systems team to over 80 experts
Developed reinforcement learning techniques
Safety and Security Committee member (until departure)
AI safety research and development

nodes.name: John Schulman
nodes.description: Head of Alignment Science (recently departed) - Co-founder and former head of alignment science at OpenAI. Prominent researcher focused on creating algorithms that allow machines to learn from interactions with their environment. Background in physics from Caltech, neuroscience at UC Berkeley, and PhD in electrical engineering and computer sciences. Recently left OpenAI to join Anthropic.
research: Former Safety and Security Committee member
Reinforcement learning and deep learning research
AI alignment and safety algorithms
Machine learning from environmental interactions

nodes.name: Microsoft Azure
nodes.description: Primary cloud partner with multi-billion dollar partnership, originally exclusive but now with right of first refusal
research: Azure OpenAI Service
AI supercomputing systems
GPU clusters
Model hosting and inference

nodes.description: Key infrastructure partner in Stargate project, providing cloud computing expertise and managing backend architecture
research: Data center infrastructure
Cloud computing capacity
AI training clusters
GPU hosting

nodes.description: Major cloud infrastructure provider with significant investment deal
research: AI-optimized cloud infrastructure
GPU clusters
Compute capacity
Model training and inference

nodes.description: Liquid cooling systems for high-density AI workloads
research: 60-120 kW power density cooling
Antifreeze coolant circulation systems

research: 5 GW power requirements equivalent to 5 nuclear reactors

research: Remote locations in Indiana, Iowa, Wyoming for abundant power

nodes.name: Anthropic
nodes.description: Major AI research lab and model developer

nodes.name: Turner Construction Company
nodes.description: The largest general contractor in the US with extensive datacenter construction experience. Selected to build Meta's hyperscale datacenter campus in Indiana.
research: Meta hyperscale datacenter campus in Jeffersonville, Indiana - part of Meta's multi-GW cluster strategy

nodes.name: Amazon (Internal/Multiple Contractors)
nodes.description: Amazon is building Project Rainier for Anthropic using multiple construction firms working simultaneously. The project spans 30 datacenters in Indiana on 1,200 acres.
research: Project Rainier - 30 datacenters in Indiana, 2.2GW power capacity, 200,000 sq ft each datacenter
Multi-site AI compute cluster across the US with hundreds of thousands of Trainium2 chips

nodes.name: Holder Construction
nodes.description: Major datacenter contractor consistently ranking in top 3 for datacenter construction. Experienced in hyperscale projects for major tech companies.
research: Various hyperscale datacenter projects (specific Anthropic projects not identified)

nodes.name: AECOM
nodes.description: Global infrastructure consulting firm providing comprehensive datacenter services including design, engineering, and construction management.
research: Infrastructure projects for major tech companies (specific Anthropic projects not identified)

nodes.name: Jason Clinton
nodes.description: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) - Jason Clinton serves as Anthropic's CISO, responsible for overseeing the company's information security strategy and protecting digital assets. He is a key spokesperson on AI security topics, including virtual AI employees and cybersecurity challenges.
research: Leading security strategy for AI virtual employees anticipated in 2025
Testing models to ensure they can withstand cyberattacks
Monitoring safety issues around threat of abuse by malicious actors
Developing security frameworks for AI agents with corporate credentials
Speaking at Confidential Computing Summit about AI security

nodes.name: Mrinank Sharma
nodes.description: Lead, Safeguards Research Team - Mrinank Sharma leads Anthropic's Safeguards Research Team, which focuses on jailbreak robustness, automated red teaming, and developing effective monitoring techniques for model misuse and misalignment.
research: Leading research on jailbreak robustness
Developing automated red teaming capabilities
Creating monitoring techniques for model misuse and misalignment
Working on Constitutional Classifiers
Building safety cases for AI systems

nodes.name: Elizabeth Kelly
nodes.description: Director, Beneficial Deployments team - Elizabeth Kelly leads Anthropic's new Beneficial Deployments team, focusing on extending AI benefits to organizations focused on social good. She previously led the U.S. AI Safety Institute and formed agreements for government safety testing of AI models.
research: Leading AI for Science program providing $20,000 API credits to researchers
Formed agreements with OpenAI and Anthropic for government safety testing
Working with organizations like FutureHouse and Benchling
Democratizing access to AI tools for scientific research

nodes.name: Holden Karnofsky
nodes.description: Member of Technical Staff - Holden Karnofsky is an AI safety researcher and philanthropist associated with Effective Altruism. He works on Anthropic's Responsible Scaling Policy and is married to Anthropic President Daniela Amodei.
research: Working on Anthropic's Responsible Scaling Policy
Contributing to protocols for managing public and societal risk around powerful AI models
AI safety research focused on existential risks

nodes.name: Richard Fontaine
nodes.description: Long-Term Benefit Trust Member - National security expert appointed to Anthropic's Long-Term Benefit Trust, bringing extensive foreign policy and national security experience to guide the company through complex AI security challenges.
research: Providing national security perspective to Anthropic's governance
Advising on global security implications of AI
Supporting democracy and global stability as part of Anthropic's mission

research: AWS Trainium and Trainium2 chips for AI training

Amazon Bedrock platform for model deployment
AWS GovCloud for government customers
AWS Secret and Top Secret Cloud Regions via SageMaker

research: Google Cloud TPU v5e chips for inference
Custom GPU and TPU clusters
